00016 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017 // XInput helper state/function
00018 // This performs extra processing on XInput gamepad data to make it slightly more convenient to use
00019 // 
00020 // Example usage:
00021 //
00022 //      DXUT_GAMEPAD gamepad[4];
00023 //      for( DWORD iPort=0; iPort<DXUT_MAX_CONTROLLERS; iPort++ )
00024 //          DXUTGetGamepadState( iPort, gamepad[iPort] );
00025 //
00026 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00027 #define DXUT_MAX_CONTROLLERS 4  // XInput handles up to 4 controllers 
00028 
00029 struct DXUT_GAMEPAD
00030 {
00031     // From XINPUT_GAMEPAD
00032     WORD wButtons;
00033     BYTE bLeftTrigger;
00034     BYTE bRightTrigger;
00035     SHORT sThumbLX;
00036     SHORT sThumbLY;
00037     SHORT sThumbRX;
00038     SHORT sThumbRY;
00039 
00040     // Device properties
00041     XINPUT_CAPABILITIES caps;
00042     bool bConnected; // If the controller is currently connected
00043     bool bInserted;  // If the controller was inserted this frame
00044     bool bRemoved;   // If the controller was removed this frame
00045 
00046     // Thumb stick values converted to range [-1,+1]
00047     float fThumbRX;
00048     float fThumbRY;
00049     float fThumbLX;
00050     float fThumbLY;
00051 
00052     // Records which buttons were pressed this frame.
00053     // These are only set on the first frame that the button is pressed
00054     WORD wPressedButtons;
00055     bool bPressedLeftTrigger;
00056     bool bPressedRightTrigger;
00057 
00058     // Last state of the buttons
00059     WORD wLastButtons;
00060     bool bLastLeftTrigger;
00061     bool bLastRightTrigger;
00062 };
00063 
00064 HRESULT DXUTGetGamepadState( DWORD dwPort, DXUT_GAMEPAD* pGamePad, bool bThumbstickDeadZone = true,
00065                              bool bSnapThumbstickToCardinals = true );
00066 HRESULT DXUTStopRumbleOnAllControllers();
00067 void DXUTEnableXInput( bool bEnable );

00069 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00070 // A growable array
00071 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00072 template<typename TYPE> class CGrowableArray
00073 {
00074 public:
00075             CGrowableArray()
00076             {
00077                 m_pData = NULL; m_nSize = 0; m_nMaxSize = 0;
00078             }
00079             CGrowableArray( const CGrowableArray <TYPE>& a )
00080             {
00081                 for( int i = 0; i < a.m_nSize; i++ ) Add( a.m_pData[i] );
00082             }
00083             ~CGrowableArray()
00084             {
00085                 RemoveAll();
00086             }
00087 
00088     const TYPE& operator[]( int nIndex ) const
00089     {
00090         return GetAt( nIndex );
00091     }
00092     TYPE& operator[]( int nIndex )
00093     {
00094         return GetAt( nIndex );
00095     }
00096 
00097     CGrowableArray& operator=( const CGrowableArray <TYPE>& a )
00098     {
00099         if( this == &a ) return *this; RemoveAll(); for( int i = 0; i < a.m_nSize;
00100                                                          i++ ) Add( a.m_pData[i] ); return *this;
00101     }
00102 
00103     HRESULT SetSize( int nNewMaxSize );
00104     HRESULT Add( const TYPE& value );
00105     HRESULT Insert( int nIndex, const TYPE& value );
00106     HRESULT SetAt( int nIndex, const TYPE& value );
00107     TYPE& GetAt( int nIndex ) const
00108     {
00109         assert( nIndex >= 0 && nIndex < m_nSize ); return m_pData[nIndex];
00110     }
00111     int     GetSize() const
00112     {
00113         return m_nSize;
00114     }
00115     TYPE* GetData()
00116     {
00117         return m_pData;
00118     }
00119     bool    Contains( const TYPE& value )
00120     {
00121         return ( -1 != IndexOf( value ) );
00122     }
00123 
00124     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value )
00125     {
00126         return ( m_nSize > 0 ) ? IndexOf( value, 0, m_nSize ) : -1;
00127     }
00128     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iStart )
00129     {
00130         return IndexOf( value, iStart, m_nSize - iStart );
00131     }
00132     int     IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex, int nNumElements );
00133 
00134     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value )
00135     {
00136         return ( m_nSize > 0 ) ? LastIndexOf( value, m_nSize - 1, m_nSize ) : -1;
00137     }
00138     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex )
00139     {
00140         return LastIndexOf( value, nIndex, nIndex + 1 );
00141     }
00142     int     LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int nIndex, int nNumElements );
00143 
00144     HRESULT Remove( int nIndex );
00145     void    RemoveAll()
00146     {
00147         SetSize( 0 );
00148     }
00149     void    Reset()
00150     {
00151         m_nSize = 0;
00152     }
00153 
00154 protected:
00155     TYPE* m_pData;      // the actual array of data
00156     int m_nSize;        // # of elements (upperBound - 1)
00157     int m_nMaxSize;     // max allocated
00158 
00159     HRESULT SetSizeInternal( int nNewMaxSize );  // This version doesn't call ctor or dtor.
00160 };

00163 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00164 // Performs timer operations
00165 // Use DXUTGetGlobalTimer() to get the global instance
00166 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00167 class CDXUTTimer
00168 {
00169 public:
00170                     CDXUTTimer();
00171 
00172     void            Reset(); // resets the timer
00173     void            Start(); // starts the timer
00174     void            Stop();  // stop (or pause) the timer
00175     void            Advance(); // advance the timer by 0.1 seconds
00176     double          GetAbsoluteTime(); // get the absolute system time
00177     double          GetTime(); // get the current time
00178     float           GetElapsedTime(); // get the time that elapsed between Get*ElapsedTime() calls
00179     void            GetTimeValues( double* pfTime, double* pfAbsoluteTime, float* pfElapsedTime ); // get all time values at once
00180     bool            IsStopped(); // returns true if timer stopped
00181 
00182     // Limit the current thread to one processor (the current one). This ensures that timing code runs
00183     // on only one processor, and will not suffer any ill effects from power management.
00184     void            LimitThreadAffinityToCurrentProc();
00185 
00186 protected:
00187     LARGE_INTEGER   GetAdjustedCurrentTime();
00188 
00189     bool m_bUsingQPF;
00190     bool m_bTimerStopped;
00191     LONGLONG m_llQPFTicksPerSec;
00192 
00193     LONGLONG m_llStopTime;
00194     LONGLONG m_llLastElapsedTime;
00195     LONGLONG m_llBaseTime;
00196 };

00244 // by DXUT to pop better message boxes.

00246 #define DXUT_ERR(str,hr)           DXUTTrace( __FILE__, (DWORD)__LINE__, hr, str, false )
00247 #define DXUT_ERR_MSGBOX(str,hr)    DXUTTrace( __FILE__, (DWORD)__LINE__, hr, str, true )
00248 #define DXUTTRACE                  DXUTOutputDebugString
00249 #else
00250 #define DXUT_ERR(str,hr)           (hr)
00251 #define DXUT_ERR_MSGBOX(str,hr)    (hr)
00252 #define DXUTTRACE                  (__noop)
00253 #endif

00304 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00305 // Profiling/instrumentation support
00306 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00307 
00308 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00309 // Some D3DPERF APIs take a color that can be used when displaying user events in 
00310 // performance analysis tools.  The following constants are provided for your 
00311 // convenience, but you can use any colors you like.
00312 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00313 const D3DCOLOR              DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR = D3DCOLOR_XRGB( 200, 100, 100 );
00314 const D3DCOLOR              DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR2 = D3DCOLOR_XRGB( 100, 200, 100 );
00315 const D3DCOLOR              DXUT_PERFEVENTCOLOR3 = D3DCOLOR_XRGB( 100, 100, 200 );
00316 
00317 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00318 // The following macros provide a convenient way for your code to call the D3DPERF 
00319 // functions only when PROFILE is defined.  If PROFILE is not defined (as for the final 
00320 // release version of a program), these macros evaluate to nothing, so no detailed event
00321 // information is embedded in your shipping program.  It is recommended that you create
00322 // and use three build configurations for your projects:
00323 //     Debug (nonoptimized code, asserts active, PROFILE defined to assist debugging)
00324 //     Profile (optimized code, asserts disabled, PROFILE defined to assist optimization)
00325 //     Release (optimized code, asserts disabled, PROFILE not defined)
00326 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00327 #ifdef PROFILE
00328 // PROFILE is defined, so these macros call the D3DPERF functions
00329 #define DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage )   DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_BeginEvent( color, pstrMessage )
00330 #define DXUT_EndPerfEvent()                         DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_EndEvent()
00331 #define DXUT_SetPerfMarker( color, pstrMessage )    DXUT_Dynamic_D3DPERF_SetMarker( color, pstrMessage )
00332 #else
00333 // PROFILE is not defined, so these macros do nothing
00334 #define DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage )   (__noop)
00335 #define DXUT_EndPerfEvent()                         (__noop)
00336 #define DXUT_SetPerfMarker( color, pstrMessage )    (__noop)
00337 #endif
00338 
00339 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00340 // CDXUTPerfEventGenerator is a helper class that makes it easy to attach begin and end
00341 // events to a block of code.  Simply define a CDXUTPerfEventGenerator variable anywhere 
00342 // in a block of code, and the class's constructor will call DXUT_BeginPerfEvent when 
00343 // the block of code begins, and the class's destructor will call DXUT_EndPerfEvent when 
00344 // the block ends.
00345 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00346 class CDXUTPerfEventGenerator
00347 {
00348 public:
00349 CDXUTPerfEventGenerator( D3DCOLOR color, LPCWSTR pstrMessage )
00350 {
00351     DXUT_BeginPerfEvent( color, pstrMessage );
00352 }
00353 ~CDXUTPerfEventGenerator( void )
00354 {
00355     DXUT_EndPerfEvent();
00356 }
00357 };

00363 // COMPILE_MULTIMON_STUBS and cause complication with MFC or other users of multimon.h
00364 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00365 #ifndef MONITOR_DEFAULTTOPRIMARY
00366 #define MONITORINFOF_PRIMARY        0x00000001
00367 #define MONITOR_DEFAULTTONULL       0x00000000
00368 #define MONITOR_DEFAULTTOPRIMARY    0x00000001

00391 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00392 // Implementation of CGrowableArray
00393 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00394 
00395 // This version doesn't call ctor or dtor.
00396 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::SetSizeInternal( int nNewMaxSize )
00397 {
00398     if( nNewMaxSize < 0 || ( nNewMaxSize > INT_MAX / sizeof( TYPE ) ) )
00399     {
00400         assert( false );
00401         return E_INVALIDARG;
00402     }
00403 
00404     if( nNewMaxSize == 0 )
00405     {
00406         // Shrink to 0 size & cleanup
00407         if( m_pData )
00408         {
00409             free( m_pData );
00410             m_pData = NULL;
00411         }
00412 
00413         m_nMaxSize = 0;
00414         m_nSize = 0;
00415     }
00416     else if( m_pData == NULL || nNewMaxSize > m_nMaxSize )
00417     {
00418         // Grow array
00419         int nGrowBy = ( m_nMaxSize == 0 ) ? 16 : m_nMaxSize;
00420 
00421         // Limit nGrowBy to keep m_nMaxSize less than INT_MAX
00422         if( ( UINT )m_nMaxSize + ( UINT )nGrowBy > ( UINT )INT_MAX )
00423             nGrowBy = INT_MAX - m_nMaxSize;
00424 
00425         nNewMaxSize = __max( nNewMaxSize, m_nMaxSize + nGrowBy );
00426 
00427         // Verify that (nNewMaxSize * sizeof(TYPE)) is not greater than UINT_MAX or the realloc will overrun
00428         if( sizeof( TYPE ) > UINT_MAX / ( UINT )nNewMaxSize )
00429             return E_INVALIDARG;
00430 
00431         TYPE* pDataNew = ( TYPE* )realloc( m_pData, nNewMaxSize * sizeof( TYPE ) );
00432         if( pDataNew == NULL )
00433             return E_OUTOFMEMORY;
00434 
00435         m_pData = pDataNew;
00436         m_nMaxSize = nNewMaxSize;
00437     }
00438 
00439     return S_OK;
00440 }
00441 
00442 
00443 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00444 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::SetSize( int nNewMaxSize )
00445 {
00446     int nOldSize = m_nSize;
00447 
00448     if( nOldSize > nNewMaxSize )
00449     {
00450         assert( m_pData );
00451         if( m_pData )
00452         {
00453             // Removing elements. Call dtor.
00454 
00455             for( int i = nNewMaxSize; i < nOldSize; ++i )
00456                 m_pData[i].~TYPE();
00457         }
00458     }
00459 
00460     // Adjust buffer.  Note that there's no need to check for error
00461     // since if it happens, nOldSize == nNewMaxSize will be true.)
00462     HRESULT hr = SetSizeInternal( nNewMaxSize );
00463 
00464     if( nOldSize < nNewMaxSize )
00465     {
00466         assert( m_pData );
00467         if( m_pData )
00468         {
00469             // Adding elements. Call ctor.
00470 
00471             for( int i = nOldSize; i < nNewMaxSize; ++i )
00472                 ::new ( &m_pData[i] ) TYPE;
00473         }
00474     }
00475 
00476     return hr;
00477 }
00478 
00479 
00480 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00481 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::Add( const TYPE& value )
00482 {
00483     HRESULT hr;
00484     if( FAILED( hr = SetSizeInternal( m_nSize + 1 ) ) )
00485         return hr;
00486 
00487     // Construct the new element
00488     ::new ( &m_pData[m_nSize] ) TYPE;
00489 
00490     // Assign
00491     m_pData[m_nSize] = value;
00492     ++m_nSize;
00493 
00494     return S_OK;
00495 }
00496 
00497 
00498 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00499 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::Insert( int nIndex, const TYPE& value )
00500 {
00501     HRESULT hr;
00502 
00503     // Validate index
00504     if( nIndex < 0 ||
00505         nIndex > m_nSize )
00506     {
00507         assert( false );
00508         return E_INVALIDARG;
00509     }
00510 
00511     // Prepare the buffer
00512     if( FAILED( hr = SetSizeInternal( m_nSize + 1 ) ) )
00513         return hr;
00514 
00515     // Shift the array
00516     MoveMemory( &m_pData[nIndex + 1], &m_pData[nIndex], sizeof( TYPE ) * ( m_nSize - nIndex ) );
00517 
00518     // Construct the new element
00519     ::new ( &m_pData[nIndex] ) TYPE;
00520 
00521     // Set the value and increase the size
00522     m_pData[nIndex] = value;
00523     ++m_nSize;
00524 
00525     return S_OK;
00526 }
00527 
00528 
00529 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00530 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::SetAt( int nIndex, const TYPE& value )
00531 {
00532     // Validate arguments
00533     if( nIndex < 0 ||
00534         nIndex >= m_nSize )
00535     {
00536         assert( false );
00537         return E_INVALIDARG;
00538     }
00539 
00540     m_pData[nIndex] = value;
00541     return S_OK;
00542 }
00543 
00544 
00545 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00546 // Searches for the specified value and returns the index of the first occurrence
00547 // within the section of the data array that extends from iStart and contains the 
00548 // specified number of elements. Returns -1 if value is not found within the given 
00549 // section.
00550 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00551 template<typename TYPE> int CGrowableArray <TYPE>::IndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iStart, int nNumElements )
00552 {
00553     // Validate arguments
00554     if( iStart < 0 ||
00555         iStart >= m_nSize ||
00556         nNumElements < 0 ||
00557         iStart + nNumElements > m_nSize )
00558     {
00559         assert( false );
00560         return -1;
00561     }
00562 
00563     // Search
00564     for( int i = iStart; i < ( iStart + nNumElements ); i++ )
00565     {
00566         if( value == m_pData[i] )
00567             return i;
00568     }
00569 
00570     // Not found
00571     return -1;
00572 }
00573 
00574 
00575 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00576 // Searches for the specified value and returns the index of the last occurrence
00577 // within the section of the data array that contains the specified number of elements
00578 // and ends at iEnd. Returns -1 if value is not found within the given section.
00579 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00580 template<typename TYPE> int CGrowableArray <TYPE>::LastIndexOf( const TYPE& value, int iEnd, int nNumElements )
00581 {
00582     // Validate arguments
00583     if( iEnd < 0 ||
00584         iEnd >= m_nSize ||
00585         nNumElements < 0 ||
00586         iEnd - nNumElements < 0 )
00587     {
00588         assert( false );
00589         return -1;
00590     }
00591 
00592     // Search
00593     for( int i = iEnd; i > ( iEnd - nNumElements ); i-- )
00594     {
00595         if( value == m_pData[i] )
00596             return i;
00597     }
00598 
00599     // Not found
00600     return -1;
00601 }
00602 
00603 
00604 
00605 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00606 template<typename TYPE> HRESULT CGrowableArray <TYPE>::Remove( int nIndex )
00607 {
00608     if( nIndex < 0 ||
00609         nIndex >= m_nSize )
00610     {
00611         assert( false );
00612         return E_INVALIDARG;
00613     }
00614 
00615     // Destruct the element to be removed
00616     m_pData[nIndex].~TYPE();
00617 
00618     // Compact the array and decrease the size
00619     MoveMemory( &m_pData[nIndex], &m_pData[nIndex + 1], sizeof( TYPE ) * ( m_nSize - ( nIndex + 1 ) ) );
00620     --m_nSize;
00621 
00622     return S_OK;
00623 }
00624 
00625 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00626 // Creates a REF or NULLREF D3D9 device and returns that device.  The caller should call
00627 // Release() when done with the device.
00628 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00629 IDirect3DDevice9*           WINAPI DXUTCreateRefDevice9( HWND hWnd, bool bNullRef = true );
00630

00632 // Creates a REF or NULLREF D3D10 device and returns the device.  The caller should call
00633 // Release() when done with the device.
00634 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00635 ID3D10Device*               WINAPI DXUTCreateRefDevice10( bool bNullRef = true );

00639 //--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00640 bool DXUTReLaunchMediaCenter();
